sub_title: Business Client Analyst at BCD Travel
summary:
Experienced and multi-skilled Business analyst with an excellent flair and proven record of success in business operations within the travel industry.  
Throughout my 13 – year career within the travel industry, I have developed the following competencies:
•	Experienced in working with high-volume entertainment/production travel within prestigious travel agencies and airlines.
•	In-depth knowledge of the nuances of working with talent and reps in a thoughtful, solution-oriented manner.
•	Highly organized with strong time management skills, keen focus, and attention to detail; thorough and able to follow up and complete tasks in a timely manner. 
•	Confident and able to express ideas thoughtfully and with passion.
•	Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously under deadlines and pressure.
•	Strong collaborator and able to work well with the team utilizing excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
•	Analytical problem-solver, able to anticipate potential problems and knows when to ask for help, and to receive and give feedback to the team.
•	Client-focused and adept at maintaining service levels with internal and external customers.

education.field_of_study: Filing Optional Services & Branded Fares certificate

school.name: Alma Mater Studiorum – Università di Bologna

certifications.name: Learn Emotional Intelligence, the Key Determiner of Success

profile_positions.description:
As a Flight Analyst I'm in in control of my own set of flights. The goal is to proactively think every day about how you can generate the most sales with the help of advanced systems and a large availability of data, to be able to determine the rates for your routes based on opportunities and choices. 
It' crucial to take responsibility for maximizing revenues on my routes by coming up with new ideas and participating in diverse projects.
profile_positions.title: Inventory Analyst

profile_positions.location: Amstelveen noord, North Holland Province, Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Work closely with (Ancillary) Pricing Managers / Directors and the Information Management Organisation to ensure correct and timely implementation of Ancillaries, Branded Fares and Charges in all relevant distribution channels with all related support and development tasks.

Analyse commercial requirements and take action to implement them in ATPCO and all relevant tools. Work on projects to optimize internal Filing and Distribution tools and processes and to improve the total Filing and Distribution process flow.

 
Main activities and responsibilities:
•Filing and implementation of Ancillaries and Branded Fares and Fees incl. administration, documentation and communication
•Thorough analysis of Filing and Distribution processes, methods and tools
•Implement new ways of distribution through tooling, GUI's, or Artificial Intelligence
•Participate in and initiate filing process/system improvement projects with internal and external parties
•Support activities to the filing/distribution process. Answering questions; solving problems from/with internal/external (ATPCO/GDS/other) stakeholders
profile_positions.title: Ancillaries Distribution & Processes Analyst

profile_positions.description:
•	Consolidate, compile and develop reports to ensure delivery of timely and accurate information on sales trends
•	Provide sales force with relevant Corporate information to ensure timely and efficient customer handling
•	Perform analyses on sales trends and performance to support in the design of business scenarios
•	Support the Global Account Manager in preparing standard reports, to ensure relevant information is provided for effective decision making
•	Receive, analyze, and respond to the Client enquiries regarding Company sales goods and services to ensure the client needs are met in the most effective and timely manner
•	Receive, record and issues sales data according to established policies and procedures to ensure data accuracy and execution of transactions according to contractual Terms & Conditions
•	Gather, review and update customers information to ensure the accuracy of master data
•	Maintain promotional database by entering promotion details, regular and special prices and promotions to provide update information to sales force and ensure consistency of offered promotions
•	Enter order and sales in the company’s system to ensure the delivery of the right product and services at the correct price and with the proper discount level
profile_positions.title: Global Account Sales Analyst

profile_positions.description:
The Knowledge Management Coordinator translates and communicates changed or new business information to operational departments, client departments and/or end customers. The Knowledge Management Coordinator supports quality and communication standard with the aim of optimizing information supply, processes and quality and by that achieving operational excellence.

•	Collecting, judging and transforming business content Collect, judge and transform changed or new business content information into the proper formats and media for receiving parties in the most effective and efficient way.

•	Knowledge management Keep all operational, quality and communication procedures and the accompanying media up to date and in line with knowledge management tools to support operational excellence in the most effective and efficient way.

•	Participating in projects Represent and actively participate as a team member in different kinds of projects on behalf of the team. As team member supports the creation, execution and communication of all relevant procedures and tasks to contribute to the reaching of the project goals at the agreed time, quality levels and budgets.

•	Continuous improvement Signal and take action upon malfunctions in processes and procedures and propose improvements
profile_positions.title: Knowledge Management Coordinator Air France / KLM

profile_positions.description:
Within procedures and timelines set by KLM/AF/DL and Cygnific, the Senior Customer Contact Representative concludes group sales with Global & Corporate Accounts, tour operators and travel agents, monitors and, if necessary, adjusts the materialization of these sales in such a way that turnover and client satisfaction for the KLM will be optimized.

•	Offering combinations of seats, fares and flight rules regarding group transportation to tour operators, travel agents, corporations and individual clients in order to conclude a group sale and by that increase the potential turnover for KLM.

•	Monitoring the timely and correct materialization of the group sales and, if necessary, cancels (part of) the group reservation in order to optimize the filling up of flight capacity and by that to increase the actual turnover for airlines.

•	Giving feedback to the establishments about the materialization of the group sales, enabling the establishments to determine trends, process limitations and the commercial importance of the various clients.

•	Ensuring good relations with establishments and, visit them and clients on an ad hoc basis, building up comprehensive understanding of their businesses, policies and needs to be able to contribute to the development of sales, customer satisfaction and optimized communication.

•	Coaching and support Customer Contact Representatives to improve knowledge and quality of the team. Contact person for escalations within responsible section. 

•	Tools & Process Support on behalf of Air France & KLM
profile_positions.title: Senior Business to Groups Air France / KLM / Delta

profile_positions.description: Within guidelines set by Luthansa, the Senior CCR informs and provides service to (potential) members of Lufthansa’s frequent flyer program “Miles & More”and to LH Establishments. The Senior CCR makes both award and revenue travel reservations for Miles & More members. Next to this, the Senior CCR also coaches (Advanced) CCRs on informing and providing these services, supporting the Mentor in improving agreed Quality standards and Average Handling Time targets.
profile_positions.title: Senior CCR Miles & More Lufthansa

profile_positions.description:
Within guidelines set by Lufthansa, the Senior Customer Contact Representative answers travel
related questions for Lufthansa coming from travel agents. By doing so in a
friendly and efficient way, the CCR increases both travel agent satisfaction and turnover. Next to
this, the Senior CCR supports the new (Junior) CCRs and the Mentors and Supervisors into
helping to increase the quantity and quality of the given service. Furthermore the Senior
Customer Contact Representative looks for improvements in the process and takes further action
if needed. If needed, acts as back up for B2C agents by answering travel related questions from
end consumers regarding flying with Lufthansa and making reservations.
profile_positions.title: Senior CCR Direct Sales Lufthansa

skills: Customer service orientation and Concern for excellence
IATA Revenue Management Diploma on course
Advanced Tigre Groups Tool of AF KLM Delta	 in Paris 2010
